description: Conversion of a mixed-use building (Use Classes B1 and C3) into four self-contained flats (Use Class C3); associated amenity, cycle parking and waste storage spaces; single-storey rear and side extensions (following demolition of existing additions); first floor rear/side infill extension; roof extension to rear of main roofslope involving raising the height of ridgeline; rear roof extension over outrigger; installation of three rooflight to front roofslope; and alterations to front, rear and side fenestrations involving removing, relocating and installing openings
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing titles: 18-023-E01; 18-023-P01; 18-023-P02; 18-023-P03 Rev. A; 18-023-P04; 18-023-P05; 18-023-P06; 18-023-P07; and 18-023-P08.

REASON: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition 2.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013). | A minimum of two (2) 240.0 litre bins dedicated to recycling, two (2) 240.0 litre bin dedicated to refuse, and four (4) 23.0 litre bins dedicated to food waste shall be provided in the forecourt of the property in accordance with dwg. 18-023-P02 of the Approved Plans and the adopted standards of the London Plan (2016). Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with the Ealing Council's Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers, as well as, policies 5.17 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | A minimum of six (6) secured cycle parking spaces shall be provided in accordance with dwg. 18-023-P02 of the Approved Plans and the adopted standards of the London Plan (2016). Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists and increase the use of active and sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies 6.1, 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016). | Enhanced sound insulation for the approved dwelling units shall be installed to achieve an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings, namely bathroom above bedroom of separate lower ground floor dwelling. The enhanced sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the unit(s) and maintained thereafter.

REASON: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and the interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | No part of any roof shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.
REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
